# Description

My research is divided into two streams: methodological EEG-related lab research on risk-taking, and longitudinal survey research on student mental health. I have recently ventured into the realm of open science research, and am actively trying to learn more about how to make my own work more open and transparent.

# Expertise

```{r radarPlot}

member_name <- "Kristel de Groot"
special_skill <- "ethics"

OS_skills <- read_csv(here("static/OS_skills.csv")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(name %in% c("max", "min", member_name)) %>%
  dplyr::select(c("open source software", all_of(special_skill), "open access", "reproducible analysis", "data management", "data sharing", "preregistration"))

# custom radar plot
radarchart(OS_skills,
  axistype = 0, seg = 10,
  pcol = alpha("#002328", 0.8), pfcol = alpha("#00B969", 0.6), plwd = 4, centerzero = TRUE, # polygon
  cglcol = "#7e7e7e", axislabcol = "#002328", caxislabels = seq(0, 10, 2), cglwd = 0.8 # grid
)

```
